How do I get the BitPay crypto debit car: How do I get the BitPay crypto debit card?
We are currently pausing all new applica: We are currently pausing all new applications for the BitPay Card as we revamp the program. The BitPay Card will only be available to U.S. residents. Join the waitlist to be notified once more information is available.
How can I spend crypto without the BitPa: How can I spend crypto without the BitPay Card?
The BitPay Card is only one of the ways: The BitPay Card is only one of the ways we help you live on crypto. More ways to spend and cash out crypto with BitPay include:
directly from your wallet with BitPay me: directly from your wallet with BitPay merchants. View a curated list of merchants who accept crypto in the
for the most popular brands and retailer: for the most popular brands and retailers.
into a stablecoin like USDC using the Bi: into a stablecoin like USDC using the BitPay app.
The BitPay Card works like any other deb: The BitPay Card works like any other debit card. But, instead of using funds from a bank account, you can add funds from the
or your Coinbase account. After funding: or your Coinbase account. After funding your card, you are ready to use it practically anywhere. Use the BitPay crypto debit card in-store or online. Need cash instead? Use it at any compatible ATM. Add funds, freeze your card, and track transactions all from the BitPay app.
Where can I use the BitPay Card?: Where can I use the BitPay Card?
U.S. residents may use the BitPay Card o: U.S. residents may use the BitPay Card online or in-store wherever major debit cards are accepted. It can also be used as an ATM card to instantly convert your Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies into dollars. Use it to travel, entertain, buy gift cards, invest, treat yourself, and live on crypto!
What coins does the BitPay Card support?: What coins does the BitPay Card support?
BitPay supports Bitcoin, major alt coins: BitPay supports Bitcoin, major alt coins, tokens, and stablecoins. We are constantly evaluating and adding new coins. Currently we support:
Is the BitPay Card a credit card or debi: Is the BitPay Card a credit card or debit card?
The BitPay card is not a crypto credit c: The BitPay card is not a crypto credit card. The BitPay card is a prepaid debit card which customers can fund via their preferred wallet within the BitPay app. The BitPay Card is available as a virtual crypto card and physical card.
How do I add funds or reload the card?: How do I add funds or reload the card?
Funds can be added to the BitPay Card th: Funds can be added to the BitPay Card through the BitPay app or BitPay website. The BitPay Card can be loaded with crypto from the BitPay Wallet or your Coinbase account.
to learn more about the process.
How do I earn cash back?: How do I earn cash back?
Earning cash back Powered by Dosh is aut: Earning cash back Powered by Dosh is automatic and easy. All you have to do is use the BitPay Card at participating merchants. You can see all the current offers curated for you at any time in the rewards section of the BitPay app.
Where can I earn cash back?: Where can I earn cash back?
There are more than 100,000 places to ge: There are more than 100,000 places to get cash back when you use the BitPay Card. You can use the BitPay app to find places near you and online offering crypto rewards.
How much cash back do I earn for using t: How much cash back do I earn for using the BitPay Card?
Each merchant is different, and the perc: Each merchant is different, and the percentage you earn will be shown next to the offer and in the offer details.
Your card has been shipped and is on its: Your card has been shipped and is on its way to you. If you don't receive it within 10 business days, please call 1-855-398-1373 Monday through Sunday from 10AM to 10PM EST.

Hey, checkout BitPay's new card. You can: Hey, checkout BitPay's new card. You can convert crypto to dollars easily. Just get the app, set up a wallet, and order the card using my code {{code}}.
Share the referral code below and we'll: Share the referral code below and we'll load $10 on your card and your friend's card after they sign up and load their first $100.

Promotion Terms: BitPay Cardholders may: Promotion Terms: BitPay Cardholders may refer others to become new Cardholders. If a referred person acquires a Card and loads at least US$100 within 30 days of signing up for the Card, then BitPay will provide an incentive US$10 Card load to both the referring Cardholder and new Cardholder. The new Cardholder must not previously have signed up for a virtual or physical BitPay Card. The referred person must sign up using the referring Cardholder’s referral code. BitPay reserves the right to modify this promotion or discontinue eligibility for the promotion at any time and in its sole discretion.

Store your assets safely and securely wi: Store your assets safely and securely with BitPay's non-custodial app. Reminder: you own your keys, so be sure to have a pen and paper handy to write down your 12 words.
Get important updates on your account, n: Get important updates on your account, new features, promos and more. You can change this at any time in Settings.

BitPay partners with multiple crypto mar: BitPay partners with multiple crypto marketplaces to ensure you get the best possible rates. Buy and swap 60+ top cryptocurrencies without leaving the app.

Discover a curated list of places you ca: Discover a curated list of places you can spend your crypto. Purchase, manage and spend store credits instantly.
Websites and exchanges get hacked. BitPa: Websites and exchanges get hacked. BitPay's self - custody wallet allows you to privately store, manage and use your crypto funds without a centralized bank or exchange.
Set up an extra layer of security to kee: Set up an extra layer of security to keep your wallet secure.
My funds are held and controlled on this: My funds are held and controlled on this device.
BitPay has no custody, access or control: BitPay has no custody, access or control over my funds
BitPay can never recover my funds for me: BitPay can never recover my funds for me.
It is my responsibility to save and main: It is my responsibility to save and maintain the 12-word recovery phrase
. Using my 12-word phrase is the only wa: . Using my 12-word phrase is the only way to recover my funds if this app is deleted or the device is lost.
If I lose my recovery phrase, it can’t b: If I lose my recovery phrase, it can’t be recovered

Grant camera permission to use the camer: Grant camera permission to use the camera for scanning QR codes. Go to Settings and tap Allow Camera.
By selecting \"Other\" as your payment m: By selecting "Other" as your payment method, you will have access to all payment methods enabled by the exchanges based on your country of residence and your selected fiat currency.
What service fees am I paying?: What service fees am I paying?
For debit/credit card or Apple Pay payme: For debit/credit card or Apple Pay payments, fees are 1.99% of the transaction.
Most bank transfers do not charge a fee. But there may be exceptions for particular cases.
For payments through PIX 3.00% of the tr: For payments through PIX 3.00% of the transaction.
Banxa also charges a service fee, which: Banxa also charges a service fee, which is included in the unit price for the transaction, based the cost of each payment method.
This service is provided by a third part: This service is provided by a third party, and you are subject to their
For card payments 4.5% of the transactio: For card payments 4.5% of the transaction with a minimum of €3.99/£3.99/$3.99 or currency equivalent.
For bank transfers 1% of the transaction: For bank transfers 1% of the transaction with a minimum of €3.99/£3.99/$3.99 or currency equivalent
For payments through PIX 2.95% of the tr: For payments through PIX 2.95% of the transaction.
Moonpay also charges a dynamic network f: Moonpay also charges a dynamic network fee on all BTC, ETH and ERC20 tokens purchases, based on the blockchain network conditions.
For card payments 3.9% of the transactio: For card payments 3.9% of the transaction with a minimum of €2.49 or currency equivalent.
For bank transfers from 1.49% to 2.99% o: For bank transfers from 1.49% to 2.99% of the transaction with a minimum of €2.49 or currency equivalent, depending on the amount and the selected transfer method
Ramp Network also charges a dynamic netw: Ramp Network also charges a dynamic network fee based on the blockchain network conditions, and a partner margin when purchasing crypto within their apps.
SardineTermsFeeInfo: Sardine charges both a network fee ({{networkFee}}% of this transaction) based on the blockchain network conditions, and a processing fee ({{transactionFee}}% of this transaction).
The network fee is paid to crypto miners: The network fee is paid to crypto miners to ensure that the transaction is processed on the crypto network.
Can range from 3.5% to 5% of the transac: Can range from 3.5% to 5% of the transaction, depending on the volume of traffic (with a minimum of 10 USD or its equivalent in any other fiat currency) + 1% of the transaction.
For card payments from 3.5% to 5.5% of t: For card payments from 3.5% to 5.5% of the transaction depending on the fiat currency.
For bank transfers 0.99% of the transact: For bank transfers 0.99% of the transaction with a minimum of €1.00 or currency equivalent.
Other payment methods can range from 0.9: Other payment methods can range from 0.99% to 7.99% the transaction, depending on the country and the payment method selected.
Transak also charges a dynamic network f: Transak also charges a dynamic network fee based on the blockchain network conditions, and a partner margin when purchasing crypto within their apps.

The final crypto amount you receive when: The final crypto amount you receive when the transaction is complete may differ because it is based on the exchange rates of the providers.
linkedWalletWarnMsg: Keep in mind that once the funds are received in your {{selectedWallet}} wallet, to move them you will need to have enough funds in your {{chain}} linked wallet {{linkedWalletName}} to pay the {{chainCoin}} miner fees.
This feature is temporarily out of servi: This feature is temporarily out of service. Please try again later.
Payment request made. You must complete: Payment request made. You must complete the purchase process with our partner Banxa.
Payment request made. If you have succes: Payment request made. If you have successfully completed the entire payment process, remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The order has been created. Banxa is wai: The order has been created. Banxa is waiting for customer to make payment for the order.
The customer has made payment, waiting f: The customer has made payment, waiting for final payment confirmation from any external payment systems.
The customer has made payment and it has: The customer has made payment and it has been confirmed.
Order is being verified and processed.
The cryptocurrency transaction has been: The cryptocurrency transaction has been submitted to the blockchain.
Thr order has been cancelled by the cust: Thr order has been cancelled by the customer during the payment process.
The order has been declined by external: The order has been declined by external payment systems.
The order has been created, but the cust: The order has been created, but the customer has not made payment for the order within the expiry time.
The order has failed at some point in th: The order has failed at some point in the process.
The order has been completed. Banxa deem: The order has been completed. Banxa deems the cryptocurrency transaction to be completed after 2 confirmations on blockchain.
The order has been refunded in response: The order has been refunded in response to a request from a customer.
Payment request made. You must complete: Payment request made. You must complete the purchase process with our partner Moonpay.
Transaction is waiting for an incoming p: Transaction is waiting for an incoming payment.
Moonpay is purchasing your crypto. This: Moonpay is purchasing your crypto. This takes between a few minutes and a few hours. Thanks for your patience.
The order has been received and authoriz: The order has been received and authorization is pending.
Coins were successfully sent to the reci: Coins were successfully sent to the recipient address.
Transaction has failed. In most cases, i: Transaction has failed. In most cases, it's because you haven't properly verified your identity or payment method or you've reached your maximum daily/weekly purchase limit.
Payment request made. You must complete: Payment request made. You must complete the purchase process with our partner Ramp.
Payment request made. You must complete the purchase process with our partner Sardine.
There is an open or ongoing order. If yo: There is an open or ongoing order. If you have successfully completed the entire payment process, remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The payment has been completed. Remember: The payment has been completed. Remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The transacation was declined, due to pa: The transacation was declined, due to payment method issues.
Crypto purchased for user but is in Sard: Crypto purchased for user but is in Sardine's custodied wallet. Remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The payment is complete and the crypto h: The payment is complete and the crypto has been delivered to the user's wallet.
Payment request made. You must complete: Payment request made. You must complete the purchase process with our partner Transak.
Payment received and being exchanged and: Payment received and being exchanged and tranferred via liquidity providers. Remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The order is on hold. Remember that rece: The order is on hold. Remember that receiving crypto may take a few hours.
The payment was refunded to the user.

If enabled, wallets will also try to spe: If enabled, wallets will also try to spend unconfirmed funds. However, unconfirmed funds are not allowed for spending with merchants, BitPay Card loads, or BitPay in-app gift card purchases.

If enabled, your eth transactions will b: If enabled, your eth transactions will be queued if there is a pending transaction with a lower account nonce. This is an advanced feature, use cautiously.

All of your wallet balance may not be av: All of your {{currencyName}} wallet balance may not be available for immediate spending.
The XRP ledger requires that all wallets: The XRP ledger requires that all wallets maintain a minimum balance of {{lockedBalance}} XRP. This non-refundable {{lockedBalance}} XRP will remain permanently locked in your wallet.
The total amount of stored in this walle: The total amount of {{wallet}} stored in this wallet.
Not including locked funds required for: Not including locked funds required for activation.
The amount of immediately spendable from: The amount of {{currencyName}} immediately spendable from this wallet.
The amount of stored in this wallet with: The amount of {{currencyName}} stored in this wallet with less than 1 blockchain confirmation.
The amount of stored in this wallet that: The amount of {{currencyName}} stored in this wallet that is allocated as inputs to your pending transaction proposals. The amount is determined using unspent transaction outputs associated with this wallet and may be more than the actual amounts associated with your pending transaction proposals.

Remember there are no special requiremen: Remember there are no special requirements for the password (numbers, symbols, etc.)
Keep in mind your encryption password is: Keep in mind your encryption password is not the 12-word recovery phrase
You can always reset your encryption pas: You can always reset your encryption password on your key settings under the option Clear Encryption Password using your 12-word recovery phrase
BCH wallets use the CashAddr format by: {{appName}} BCH wallets use the CashAddr format by default
If you need to send to \"old\" addresses: If you need to send to "old" addresses (like the one you just pasted), and you are SURE those are BCH addresses, you can "translate" them to the corresponding address in CashAddr format.
The wallet you are using does not match: The wallet you are using does not match the network and/or the currency of the address provided
Be careful. Some inputs of this transac: Be careful. Some inputs of this transaction have no confirmations. Please wait until they are confirmed.
Be careful. Until it confirms, the trans: Be careful. Until it confirms, the transaction could be replaced/redirected by the sender. You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee
This transaction is taking longer than u: This transaction is taking longer than usual to confirm. You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee.
You can try to speed it up by using a hi: You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee
The fee you are using is lower than Supe: The fee you are using is lower than Super Economy level. It’s not recommended as this transaction may not confirm or will take very long to confirm.
Insufficient funds for paying speed up f: Insufficient funds for paying speed up fee.

Only receive tokens on PROTOCOLNAMES net: Only receive tokens on {{protocolNames}} networks to avoid losing funds
There are no records of your wallet on o: There are no records of your wallet on our servers. If you are importing a BIP44 compatible wallet from a 3rd party you can continue to recreate it. If you wallet is not BIP44 compatible, you will not be able to access its funds.
Make sure to enter your password in adva: Make sure to enter your password in advanced options
Invalid derivation path for selected coi: Invalid derivation path for selected coin
Enter your recovery phrase (usually 12-w: Enter your recovery phrase (usually 12-words) in the correct order. Separate each word with a single space only (no commas or any other punctuation). For backup phrases in non-English languages: Some words may include special symbols, so be sure to spell all the words correctly.
This process may take a few minutes to c: This process may take a few minutes to complete.
This field is only for users who, in pre: This field is only for users who, in previous versions (it's not supported anymore), set a password to protect their recovery phrase. This field is not for your encrypt password.
Your encryption password has been remove: Your encryption password has been removed. This key is now decrypted.
To disable encryption for your wallet, p: To disable encryption for your wallet, please enter your encryption password below.
You are about to send COIN using the PRO: You are about to send {{coin}} using the {{protocolName}} Network. Make sure your recipient is expecting this exact asset and network. BitPay is not responsible for any funds lost.
To get started, you’ll need to enter a v: To get started, you’ll need to enter a valid address or select an existing contact or wallet.
Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin, and: Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin, and also tokens like USDC and APE
Requires multiple people or devices and: Requires multiple people or devices and is the most secure
This currency is already associated with: This currency is already associated with the selected wallet
Could not find any ERC20 contract attach: Could not find any ERC20 contract attached to the provided address. Recheck the contract address and network of the associated wallet.
You will not be able to add funds to you: You will not be able to add funds to your wallet until you backup your recovery phrase.
Would you like to backup your key?: Would you like to backup your key?
If you delete the BitPay app or lose you: If you delete the BitPay app or lose your device, you'll need your recovery phrase regain access to your funds.
The file could not be shared: The file could not be shared
Would you like to backup your wallet?: Would you like to backup your wallet?
If you delete the BitPay app or lose you: If you delete the BitPay app or lose your device, you’ll need your recovery phrase regain acess to your funds.
Because your encrypted password is not s: Because your encrypted password is not stored by BitPay, there is no way to reset it.
If you need to regain access to your wal: If you need to regain access to your wallet because you have forgotten or lost the encrypt password, you must restore the wallet using the 12 word recovery phrase.
If you do not have the recovery phrase,: If you do not have the recovery phrase, you will not be able to regain access to your wallet
Share this invitation with the devices j: Share this invitation with the devices joining this account. Each copayer has their own recovery phrase. To recover funds stored in a Shared Wallet you will need the recovery phrase from each copayer.
Waiting for authorized copayers to join: Waiting for authorized copayers to join
Your encryption password has been set. T: Your encryption password has been set. This key is now encrypted.
Your wallet will be encrypted. Whenever: Your wallet will be encrypted. Whenever you make a transaction, we will ask for the password. This cannot be recovered, so be sure to store it safely.
Multisig wallets require multisig device: Multisig wallets require multisig devices to set up. It takes longer to complete but it's the recommended security configuration for long term storage.
The single address feature will force th: The single address feature will force the wallet to only use one address rather than generating new addresses.
Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin and: Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin and also tokens like USDC and APE
Use an existing recovery phrase to impor: Use an existing recovery phrase to import an existing wallet
Tokens on the Ethereum network need an E: Tokens on the Ethereum network need an Ethereum wallet to pay for fees.
Tokens on the Polygon network need a Pol: Tokens on the Polygon network need a Polygon wallet to pay for fees.
Tokens on the Base network need an Ether: Tokens on the Base network need an Ethereum wallet to pay for fees.
Tokens on the Optimism network need an E: Tokens on the Optimism network need an Ethereum wallet to pay for fees.
Tokens on the Arbitrum network need an E: Tokens on the Arbitrum network need an Ethereum wallet to pay for fees.
Permanently deletes all wallets using th: Permanently deletes all wallets using this key.
Are you sure you want to delete all wall: Are you sure you want to delete all wallets using this key?
Your wallet is all that is needed to acc: Your wallet is all that is needed to access your funds. Be sure to protect your wallet and store it only on secure devices. BitPay does not have access to your recovery phrase, so you alone are responsible for your wallets. If you share wallet access with external services, you take responsibility for the risk of theft or breach.
You can import this wallet into other de: You can import this wallet into other devices through the BitPay scanner.
Your extended private keys are all that: Your extended private keys are all that is needed to access your funds. Be sure to protect your private keys and store them only on secure devices. BitPay does not have access to your private keys, so you alone are responsible for your keys. If you share key access with external services, you take responsibility for the risk of theft or breach. Only advanced users should handle extended private keys directly.
There are no wallets with funds availabl: There are no wallets with funds available to use this feature.
Your wallet balance is too low to sell c: Your wallet balance is too low to sell crypto. Add funds now and start selling.
Your wallet balance is too low to swap c: Your wallet balance is too low to swap crypto. Add funds now and start swapping.
A wallet is like a vault stored on your: A wallet is like a vault stored on your device containing your crypto funds. Much like a vault, your wallet will only be accessible with the recovery phrase.
Your wallet recovery phrase is composed: Your wallet recovery phrase is composed of 12 randomly selected words. If you ever lose or damage your device, you can re-gain access to your wallet as long as you have your 12-word recovery phrase.
In order to protect your funds from bein: In order to protect your funds from being accessible to hackers and thieves, the recovery phrase must be kept somewhere safe and remain a secret.
Choose another currency you would like t: Choose another currency you would like to add to your key.
Prevent an unauthorized user from sendin: Prevent an unauthorized user from sending funds out of your wallet.
View all the ways to manage and configur: View all the ways to manage and configure your key.
To continue please enter your encryption: To continue please enter your encryption password.
This password cannot be recovered. If th: This password cannot be recovered. If this password is lost, funds can only be recovered by reimporting your 12-word recovery phrase.
Use more than one device to create a mul: Use more than one device to create a multisig wallet
Joining another user's multisig wallet r: Joining another user's multisig wallet requires an invitation to join
Your recovery key is composed of 12 rand: Your recovery key is composed of 12 randomly selected words. Take a couple of minutes to carefully write down each word in the order they appear.
Share this QR code to receive in your wa: Share this QR code to receive {{amountUnitStr}} in your wallet {{walletName}}.
Due to high demand, miner fees are high. Fees are paid to miners who process transactions and are not paid to BitPay.
A Destination Tag is an optional number: A Destination Tag is an optional number that corresponds to an invoice or a XRP account on an exchange.

In order to protect your funds from bein: In order to protect your funds from being accessible to hackers and thieves, store this recovery phrase in a safe and secure place.
The recovery phrase you provided was inc: The recovery phrase you provided was incorrect.
Your recovery key is composed of 12 rand: Your recovery key is composed of 12 randomly selected words. Take a couple of minutes to carefully write down each word in order they appear.
Verify you saved your recovery phrase co: Verify you saved your recovery phrase correctly by writing in the {{first}} ({{firstNumber}}), {{second}} ({{secondNumber}}) and {{third}} ({{thirdNumber}}) word in your recovery phrase.
Each wallet can generate billions of add: Each wallet can generate billions of addresses from your 12-word recovery phrase. A new address is automatically generated and shown each time you receive a payment.
It's a good idea to avoid reusing addres: It's a good idea to avoid reusing addresses - this both protects your privacy and keeps your assets secure against hypothetical attacks by quantum computers.

The transaction history and every new in: The transaction history and every new incoming transaction are cached in the app. Clearing the cache cleans up the transaction history and synchronizes again from the server.

After you create a ZenLedger account or: After you create a ZenLedger account or log in with your existing account, BitPay will automatically send your Wallet Addresses to Zenledger to be imported.
ZenLedger makes crypto taxes easy. Log I: ZenLedger makes crypto taxes easy. Log In or Create your ZenLedger Account and BitPay will import your wallets for you.

Cannot continue because sell order with: Cannot continue because sell order with id: {{transactionId}} has failed for some reason or has been canceled. Please try creating a new order from our Sell Crypto feature.

20 Wallet limit from the same coin and n: 20 Wallet limit from the same coin and network has been reached.
The selected wallet is currently not sup: The selected wallet is currently not supported to use this feature.

Backup format not recognized. If you are: Backup format not recognized. If you are using a Copay Beta backup and version is older than 0.10, please see:
There is a pending transaction with a lo: There is a pending transaction with a lower account nonce. Wait for your pending transactions to confirm or enable "ETH Queued transactions" in Advanced Settings.
Cannot send XRP to the same wallet you a: Cannot send XRP to the same wallet you are trying to send from. Please check the destination address and try it again.
A total of were excluded. These funds co: A total of {{amountBelowFeeStr}} {{currencyAbbreviation}} were excluded. These funds come from UTXOs smaller than the network fee provided
A total of were excluded. The maximum si: A total of {{amountAboveMaxSizeStr}} {{currencyAbbreviation}} were excluded. The maximum size allowed for a transaction was exceeded.
You do not have enough confirmed funds t: You do not have enough confirmed funds to make this payment. Wait for your pending transactions to confirm or enable "Use unconfirmed funds" in Advanced Settings.
You currently don't have any wallets cap: You currently don't have any wallets capable of sending this payment. Would you like to import one?
You do not have any funds to send.
The total amount is the subtotal amount: The total amount is the subtotal amount plus transaction fees.
For BitPay invoices the subtotal amount: For BitPay invoices the subtotal amount is the product or service amount plus network costs.
To continue you will need to add a walle: To continue you will need to add a wallet to your key.
To continue you will need to create a ke: To continue you will need to create a key and add a wallet.
